abstract: Residents of mostly white Brooklyn Heights neighborhood complain about basketball courts in nearby Brooklyn Bridge Park, which draw rowdy teenagers who often walk down quiet Joralemon Street to get there; park had been closed several times due to fights and threats of violence, but players, many of whom are black and come from all around New York City, feel they are subject of racial bias.
lead_paragraph: Some Brooklyn Heights residents say the crowds drawn to the park’s basketball courts are damaging the neighborhood, but the players believe they are the victims of racial stereotyping.

headline.main: In Brooklyn Bridge Park Conflict, Neighbors See Trouble. Players See Intolerance.
headline.print_headline: At Brooklyn Bridge Park, Unruly Crowds Upset Neighbors
